newsitem.title: USA: PaineWebber names O'Hanlon head int'l fixed income.
newsitem.headline: PaineWebber names O'Hanlon head int'l fixed income.

text.p: PaineWebber Inc said Friday it has named Michael O'Hanlon to head the firm's London-based international fixed income efforts. He replaces Jeremy Dougall, who the company said will be leaving the firm to pursue other interests.
The company also said that Alison Cottrell will become chief international economist, the position previously held by O'Hanlon.
In other management changes, PaineWebber said that Antony Simcock, managing director, will head non-US dollar government trading in London and report to O'Hanlon.
Steve Hones, managing director, will head corporate trading in London and report to Ronnie Dick, managing director and head of all corporate trading and capital market activities internationally.
Dick in London and J.J. McKoan in New York will also co-head a new Global Credit Capital Markets and Trading group, unifying the firm's efforts across all corporate issuance and distribution of debt.
